prog04

Class EarShooterMainClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PApplet
      • prog04.EarShooterMainClass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants, ApplicationConstants

    public class EarShooterMainClass
extends processing.core.PApplet
implements ApplicationConstants
    This draws and updates all of the objects and the background The user can also interact with the game by pressing the kes listed above
    Author:
    Paige Courtemanche and jyh

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw()
      Processing sketch rendering callback function
      private void handleKeyPressed()
      These are the game key controls 'LEFT', 'a', '[' make the spaceship spin left 'RIGHT', 'd', ']' make the spaceship spin left 'UP' and 'w' make the spaceship move in the direction it is facing
      void hitCheck()
      This method checks each asteroid to see if any of the missiles struck it If a missile hits an asteroid, both the missile and the asteroid disappear
      void keyReleased()
      Processing callback function for keyboard events See the top of file to see what each key press means
      static void main(java.lang.String[] argv) 
      void mousePressed()
      When the mouse is pressed, a new missile is made and added to the list of missiles
      void settings()
      This is the settings function where the window is defined
      void setup()
      The world is setup and the spaceship and asteroids are created
      void update()
      Updates the locations of the objects based on how much time has passed

        private int lastUpdateTime_
        Variable keeping track of the last time the update method was invoked. The different between current time and last time is sent to the update method of each object.
